newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak bourse paralyzed by money mkt instability.
newsitem.headline: Slovak bourse paralyzed by money mkt instability.

text.p: The Slovak SAX index lost another 1.43 points in listless trading on the Bratislava Stock Exchange (BSE) on Wednesday with brokers blaming the current instability on the money markets.
"Current instability on the money market has been completely paralyzing the activity on the stock exchange," Dusan Sykora of ING Barings said.
Sykora said that political turbulence after the failed referendums at the weekend marred any chances for a revival on the share market for a long time to come.
"I think that nothing else but time can help this," he added.
Oil refiner Slovnaft dominated trading on the bourse floor with 2,592 traded shares, closing up five at 1,040 crowns.
"However, there is still a theoretical hope that Slovak shares will become more interesting soon, as their prices seem to be already falling," Sykora said.
Overall volume fell to 171,313 shares, from 463,565 shares traded on Tuesday, while turnover decreased to 45.36 million crowns, from 118.53 million.
